noun.description: A continuous rattling sound as of hard objects falling or striking each other.
examples: the horse spun around with a clatter of hooves
she dropped her knife and fork with a clatter

verb.description: Make or cause to make a continuous rattling sound.
examples: her coffee cup clattered in the saucer
she clattered cups and saucers onto a tray

origin: Old English (as a verb), of imitative origin.
